references.paper_title: Probabilistic Reasoning in Intelligent Systems: Networks of Plausible Inference
references.reason: This book is foundational to the field of causal inference, providing the theoretical basis for much of the work on causal discovery and causal modeling that underpins the current research.
This paper provides fundamental theoretical results on the identifiability and learnability of latent tree models, which are a specific type of hierarchical model relevant to this research.

references.paper_title: Bayesian pyramids: Identifiable multilayer discrete latent structure models for discrete data
references.reason: This paper addresses the identifiability of hierarchical models with discrete variables, directly tackling a key challenge addressed in the current research.

references.paper_title: Learning latent causal graphs via mixture oracles
references.reason: This paper introduces a novel method for learning latent causal graphs using mixture oracles, which is highly relevant to the techniques used in identifying the hierarchical model presented in this paper.

references.paper_title: A versatile causal discovery framework to allow causally-related hidden variables
references.reason: This paper presents a novel algorithm for causal discovery that can handle hierarchical structures and multiple paths, thus directly addressing the complexity of the model considered in this paper.
